top_categories.workout_context: Hellhole Gravel Grind Stage Race’s 150-mile distance demands power production deep into fatigue — the defining challenge of ultra-distance gravel.
Hellhole Gravel Grind Stage Race rewards athletes who can hold sustained power without blowing up — threshold is the engine that drives everything above Zone 2.
Hellhole Gravel Grind Stage Race’s south carolina rolling gravel, multi-day stage race demands rapid power changes — surge over obstacles, settle on smoother sections, repeat for hours.
Racing Hellhole Gravel Grind Stage Race isn’t just fitness — it’s pacing, fueling, and executing when conditions deteriorate. This workout practices the race itself.
The G-Spot zone (88–92% FTP) is where you’ll spend the hardest sustained miles of Hellhole Gravel Grind Stage Race. Make this intensity feel like home.
At 150 miles, Hellhole Gravel Grind Stage Race rewards a massive aerobic engine. This volume work builds the fat-oxidation capacity that keeps you moving when glycogen runs low.
Every session at Hellhole Gravel Grind Stage Race intensity builds on this aerobic foundation — the endurance base is the soil everything else grows in.
Over-unders train the lactate clearance you’ll need at Hellhole Gravel Grind Stage Race when surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding hard.
Blended sessions combine endurance with intensity spikes — exactly what Hellhole Gravel Grind Stage Race’s south carolina rolling gravel delivers on race day.
Hellhole Gravel Grind Stage Race’s south carolina rolling gravel and competitive field demand explosive aerobic capacity — the ability to respond to surges without blowing up.
Tempo is the race-day intensity of Hellhole Gravel Grind Stage Race. Harder than Z2, easier than threshold — the pace you’ll hold for hours on south carolina rolling gravel.
Critical power determines how long you can sustain above-threshold efforts at Hellhole Gravel Grind Stage Race — a higher CP means more time in the red before failure.

race_overlay.nutrition: Ultra-distance fueling for 150 miles: 80–100g carbs/hour from mile 1 — don’t wait until you’re hungry. Practice your exact race-day nutrition in every long training ride. Carry backup calories. 150 miles burns 8,000–12,000+ calories — you cannot replace them all, but you must try.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Hellhole Gravel Grind Stage Race requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on south carolina rolling gravel to build confidence. Expect: south carolina rolling gravel, multi-day stage race, regional event.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Durability, TT Threshold, and Gravel Specific to prepare you for 150 miles of south carolina rolling gravel in Jamestown, South Carolina.
